website_summaries.verdict: These are attractive, easy to use and heavy-duty. They're also user-friendly, though some assembly is required.
pros: The built-in wire management system keeps you from having unsightly wires hanging loose, and the design is appealing and blends in with home decor
They're sleek and durable without much bulk
cons: They're only 24 inches, so they're not the best pick if you need high-standing speakers

customer_reviews.title: most 2-way bookshelf speakers work best on 24" stands
customer_reviews.text: I've owned many pairs of speakers and most "bookshelf" speakers aren't meant to be place on bookshelves. As a general rule, most 2-way bookshelf speakers work best on 24" stands. Stable speaker stands tend to be very expensive. I've owned very high end stands and some not-so high end stands. These stands are much closer to high end stands at not-so high end stand prices. They are very stable and look quite nice under almost any speakers. If I could buy Sound Anchor stands at this price, I would. However, given all of the options, these offer the best value that I can find.
customer_reviews.author: JJohnson

customer_reviews.title: Very solid stand that will handle any almost speaker and do it in style
customer_reviews.text: Stop looking for speaker stands! This is a solid product and coming from someone who is very critical and has read reviews on basically every stand out there. I almost went with the 24" sanus (wood) stand. I was hesitant to pull the trigger on these due to do few reviews......don't hesitate!! I have a pair of Polk Audio RTiA3 book shelf speakers sitting on them (also highly recommended). These speakers are large and these stands compliment them perfectly. I was looking for stands that would keep speakers at ear level. These stands met my needs in every way. only thing I would say is if the hole to feed the wires was on the bottomof the stand. Kudos TransDeco!!!
customer_reviews.author: Parviz Mahabadi

customer_reviews.title: These are great for my rear surround sound speakers
customer_reviews.text: These are great for my rear surround sound speakers. I have rather heavy MartinLogan LX16 (Motion 15) speakers. I was afraid they'd slide off or that the whole stand would easily tip over or move. I'm a little conservative so I put some double sided 3M poster tape on the bottom of the speakers to secure them to the stands. The stands themselves are quite hardcore and heavy. If you really wanted to you could kick them over, but just walking around the house if someone accidentally bumps into them, they're heavy enough that they wouldn't tip over or move much. I'm very satisfied with these.
customer_reviews.author: Nick S.

customer_reviews.title: Treat Your Bookshelf Speakers Right
customer_reviews.text: One bolt and washer in the bottom plate into the post, one bolt into the top plate into the posts top, screw in the spikes, affix the adhesive squares, and you're up and running! I gotta admit the cardboard box it came in was overtaped and the styrofoam protection splintered into pieces when I touched it. Getting in the box was the only negative. The tempered glass base and top have the weightiness you need for good sound from your speakers. Georgous looks, high style. Overall, very pleased about the product.
customer_reviews.author: Louis P

customer_reviews.title: Good build quality, but quality control could be better!
customer_reviews.text: These stands look great and have nice weight to them. I did notice two quality control issues. #1 The glass bases were slightly different sizes by at least 1/4 inch. #2 the hole in one of the bases was slightly off center. However, I was able to center the post on the base. The hole in the bases are about 3/4 inch, which allows for some adjustment for positioning the posts. I am happy with the purchase, and would recommend! I also purchased some .75 inch isolation pads to attach to the top plate. The one that come with the stand are quite thin and dont grip very well.
customer_reviews.author: M. Owens

customer_reviews.title: I was skeptical!
customer_reviews.text: I was annoyed to be paying this much for a (set of) speaker stands, but after reading other reviews, I decided to pull the trigger. Like seriously, I've bought speakers that cost as much as this! But... glad I did! These are seriously, seriously nice. Much nicer than I expected for the price. The bases of these are very, very heavy. A solid chunk of 1/2" think tempered glass, which really helps with front-heavy bookshelf speakers. And when I rap my knuckles on them speakers, they make a nice solid *thunk*. Allayed my concerns about my nice speakers tipping over!
customer_reviews.author: Wesley Isacks

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful and serious speaker stand!
customer_reviews.text: It is just heavy enough so that it won't tip over easily yet not too heavy that it's as if I'm moving free weights. When I bought my B&W CM6 S2 speakers on a significant discount I was disappointed to learn that B&W had discontinued the matching black stands. These stands match perfectly and I couldn't be happier - it's as if they were made for the B&W speakers.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory A.

customer_reviews.title: Great Product!
customer_reviews.text: Very impressed with these speaker stands! Pros: Flawless black finish - attractive (wife even thinks they look great in our living room) - solid with 30 pound speakers sitting on top - priced competitively - easy to set up. Cons: Shipping was a bit slow - styrofoam packaging was a bit messy to clean up but DID protect stands well in shipment. Summary: a very nice product that does what they are designed to do well, and look great doing it! Very good value. Definitely would purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Floyd4Al

customer_reviews.title: High end stands for an amazing price.
customer_reviews.text: Takes just under 10 minutes to assemble both stands. The base is actually black glass and it has a very high end, polished look. Very detailed with spikes on the bottom, soft felt circles for the shelf and convenient holes to hide your speaker wire. Perfect for Polk Tsi200 bookshelf speakers because the top of the speakers also have black glass like the stands so they look made for each other.
customer_reviews.author: Darwin Magilicuty

customer_reviews.title: Look fantastic.
customer_reviews.text: I got these for my SVS bookshelf speakers. The stand's finish looks great with the black piano gloss finish of the speakers. Very easy to assemble. They are very sturdy. I did not have to weigh them down with sand even though they are sitting on thick carpet. I shopped for two months before finding these. You cannot go wrong on purchasing these stands.
customer_reviews.author: Doug C

customer_reviews.title: Well made and great price
customer_reviews.text: Well made, bought it for a pair of KEF Reference 3 speakers, holds them well. The KEF’s own speaker stands are 3 times this price not worth it
customer_reviews.author: SREEHARSHA GADAGKAR

customer_reviews.title: One tiny glitch...
customer_reviews.text: Arrived in perfect condition. Works great. Looks great. Only improvement i would make is to have the speaker wire enter from underneath the stand. As it is, the wire travels through a large diameter hole in the support pole.
customer_reviews.author: Steffan Santoro

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with these speaker stands and I thinks you will be as well!
customer_reviews.text: These stands look fanastic and match my gloss black speakers. I filled them up with about 15 pounds of steel BBs for each stand. Adjusting the four spikes on each stand will make them very stable. I found a plastic plug at the local hardwear store to seal the speaker holes, but it would be nice if they came with the stands. But the stands are a great purchase, just make certain you run the speakers through them before filling them up.
customer_reviews.author: LGS

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, heavy
customer_reviews.text: Sure, you COULD spend lots more and get marginally better speaker stands. And maybe there’d be some kind of improvement in sound. But honestly, probably not. These stands are heavy, the right height (do measure before purchase), attractive, and can hold heavy speakers. They’re perfect. Buy with confidence.
customer_reviews.author: RoundelMike

customer_reviews.title: Great speaker stands
customer_reviews.text: When looking for stands for my surround home theater speakers I narrowed my choices down to three. These TransDeco stands were the most expensive of the three. For that reason, I almost didn't pick these but at the last moment, I decided to buy anyway. Glad I did. They are beautiful and, with the thick glass base, are heavy enough so that they won't easily fall over if accidentally bumped.
customer_reviews.author: Lee Olson

customer_reviews.title: High End Stand
customer_reviews.text: These stands are exactly what I wanted. They match my black glass TV stand. They look high end. I have a pair of Polk LSiM 703's sitting on top of them. They are heavy enough that I don't have to fill them with sand. They are a perfect listening height for my area. I couldn't be more pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Bslep

customer_reviews.title: Great speaker stands!
customer_reviews.text: I couldn't wait to get these stands and put my brand new NHT C3's on them. They were easy to put together, very solid and the 24 inch height was perfect for my living room. The package was a little damaged from Amazon delivery but they were packaged so great it didn't hurt them. They look much nicer in person. I couldn't be happier.
customer_reviews.author: ALLEN

customer_reviews.title: Great stands for the money.
customer_reviews.text: Great Speaker stands at a reasonable price. I have large high end Monitor Audio bookshelf speakers which look great on these stands. The stands are very stable on my thick carpet.
customer_reviews.author: El Phillips

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: Great stand looks like I paid much more than I did . To make them great your going to need some things links a rubber mat for the speakers to sit on and better spikes then the ones they com with . So a extra 20 $ and your world of sound will change
customer_reviews.author: Shaun

customer_reviews.title: Great Looking Stands.
customer_reviews.text: Pleasantly surprised on the quality. Beautiful style and fit & finish. Pictured is the 24" version. Using them for rear surround setup with a perfect result while sitting. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Critter

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy and attractive. Using with Polk LSIM 703 which are 30 lbs. each
customer_reviews.author: L. Cox

customer_reviews.title: Wow. Much better than expected. It's a steal.
customer_reviews.text: Wow. What a steal. Solid and very elegant stands that can hold a good size speaker. Two screws and it's put together. The hardest part is removing it from the box. Seriously. Very easy to assemble.
customer_reviews.author: David Bennett

customer_reviews.title: Well made and look great - make sure you tighten down securely with a ...
customer_reviews.text: Well made and look great - make sure you tighten down securely with a longer allen wrench then supplied, as there is only a single bolt to hold each top and bottom plate.
customer_reviews.author: tokenography_com

customer_reviews.title: Worth twice the price!
customer_reviews.text: Very sexy speaker stands worth twice the price. Very easy to assemble. Packaged well, came in mint condition. I assembled the bottom plate of the base backwards so that it would be less likely to tip forward.
customer_reviews.author: Master Brad

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful Speaker Stands with great look
customer_reviews.text: We use in it the studio for presenting broadcast audio mixes to the clients. The stands are prefect for the application where they look great and the heights are prefect to make the studios look like home.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne Khin

customer_reviews.title: Good Speaker Stands
customer_reviews.text: Attractive speaker stands. Have Polk Lsim 703 speakers on these. They work great. The speakers are heavy and large these stands handle them with no problem.
customer_reviews.author: Maurice W. Carney

customer_reviews.title: Be sure to fill with some bulk material - sand/rice/etc.
customer_reviews.text: These are good quality stands for the money. I filled them with rice (5lbs each) which made noticeable improvements to sound.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Dunne

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy & elegant
customer_reviews.text: These stands are absolutely gorgeous! Easy to assemble and extremely sturdy. These are definitely a Best Buy for anyone with bookshelf speakers.
customer_reviews.author: Ant

customer_reviews.title: Nice for the price!
customer_reviews.text: Actually, I would give it 4 1/2 stars. Why not five? Well the glass bases are polished very unevenly. An easy fix could make this a solid five star. In all honesty you can't really notice it unless I point it out or the light hits it a certain way. Can't really be to upset considering the price and they match my smoked glass stereo rack nicely.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: finish and accessories are good but you won't be blown away
customer_reviews.text: Stylish and very strong. Using them for a pair of Jamo C103s that weigh 25 pounds each. Fit, finish and accessories are good but you won't be blown away. One of the more economical options for higher weight speakers.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Bixby

customer_reviews.title: We’re it necessary, I’d buy this item again
customer_reviews.text: Easy to setup. Ability to withstand the weight of large speakers. Impeccable fit and finish. Packaged well. Pleased with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Lyndon Edwards

customer_reviews.title: Well built, classy speaker stands
customer_reviews.text: Really solid build, the stands hold my Cambridge Soundworks M80s easily. The tempered glass base is reassuringly heavy and looks classy.
customer_reviews.author: Eddie B

customer_reviews.title: Mine are not 24 inches high
customer_reviews.text: I don't think the spike length should be included in the height.
customer_reviews.author: P. Graham

customer_reviews.title: Look nice
customer_reviews.text: I got these to support my new Edifier R1280DB self-powered bookshelf speakers. These cost almost as much as the speakers, but were simple to assemble and look sharp.
customer_reviews.author: Backwards

customer_reviews.title: One of the good ones.
customer_reviews.text: Yep. These are good. Solid. Classy. Not overpriced. I may just buy another set- can’t give higher praise than that.
customer_reviews.author: JMO

customer_reviews.title: Quality
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice stand. Solid. Looks good. Not cheap, but overall a good value. I would buy them again.
customer_reviews.author: Audio K

customer_reviews.title: The glass baseplate is really not heavy enough, but looks good.
customer_reviews.text: My carpet is fairly thick and I could not get the spikes extended enough to pierce to the concrete. So the carpet pushes up on the base plate and makes the stand wobble. I tried filling the column with sand for more weight, but it wasn't enough to hold it down.
customer_reviews.author: Plinytheother

customer_reviews.title: These are good looking, heavy
customer_reviews.text: These are good looking, heavy, sturdy, easy to assemble with well machined hardware and a glossy finish, just the right height, and a bargain!
customer_reviews.author: Life is Good

customer_reviews.title: Great speaker stands!
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful and heavy speaker stands. I'm impressed with the quality at this price.
customer_reviews.author: Pat

customer_reviews.title: Great design, great value
customer_reviews.text: These are very good quality stands for the money and at 24 inches, they provide the perfect hight for home theater and/or listening to music. My Dynaudio speakers sit perfectly on them and I did not have to add any additional weight for stability.
customer_reviews.author: Nunya

customer_reviews.title: Great quality, great looks.
customer_reviews.text: Great set of speaker stands. Holds my bookshelf speakers (11" x 7") perfectly and looks great.
customer_reviews.author: db

customer_reviews.title: Heavymetal
customer_reviews.text: I had many speaker stands before, these are quality heavy duty great looking stands, not junk usually offered...
customer_reviews.author: Trfsigguy

customer_reviews.title: Nice bookshelf speaker stand
customer_reviews.text: really like the glass bottom. classy looking yet the price is great. filled with kitty litter and made a longer top plate to fasten my B+W 805s. installed some B+W stickers that i found on eBay, nice stands.
customer_reviews.author: Robert J. White

customer_reviews.title: Great stands
customer_reviews.text: Very good quality and very stable on the floor. They look great and would have been even better if there was a way to route the cable through the bottom glass. Need to get a second pair.
customer_reviews.author: Constantin

customer_reviews.title: Great speaker stands.
customer_reviews.text: Top quality speaker stands. Look very nice and are very sturdy. Way better than expected.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent stands
customer_reviews.text: Good-looking and solid. Quite stable with 20lb speakers. Paint on screw made assembly a bit of a pain.
customer_reviews.author: David Rowe

customer_reviews.title: Very nice stands
customer_reviews.text: I'm not an audiophile so this is just a layman review. These stands are just as I imagined, beautiful gloss black and sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great stands for the money
customer_reviews.text: Great stands for the money. Looks a feel like expensive stands. Well worth the extra $ vs the cheaper wood ones
customer_reviews.author: AmazonShopper

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Could not be happier. Quick shipment, as if new and looks fine, solidly built. Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: Doug Best

customer_reviews.title: Wife Approves
customer_reviews.text: These are fine stands but the most important think is my wife likes them.
customer_reviews.author: C. Mann

customer_reviews.title: I Would Recommend
customer_reviews.text: Great stands! I use them in my recording studio with 80 lbs of speakers on top of each stand. They're rock solid!! Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Mai Hariu-Powell

customer_reviews.title: Looks nice
customer_reviews.text: Looks nice, sturdy and easy to Balance. I’d prefer to have the option of feeding the wire to under base.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Fill with sand or kitty litter and you are good to go
customer_reviews.text: Fill with sand or kitty litter and you are good to go! I particularly like the heavy glass base. Great product at a fair price.
customer_reviews.author: harlemhomeboy

customer_reviews.title: Great Stands
customer_reviews.text: These stands do what they are supposed to do and look good. I have big speakers and these do make me nervous. Definitely buying some sand and will see if that makes them more stable.
customer_reviews.author: JG

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Look good. Has a hole in the back to cable through the tube portion !!
customer_reviews.author: Howie Ramone

customer_reviews.title: Good value for solid stands. Just the right height for KEF Q100.
customer_reviews.text: These are a perfect fit for my KEF Q100 speakers. Stable and solid on a carpet with spikes. I like the cable management.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Well Made at Good Price
customer_reviews.text: Great value. Quality speakers are bookshelf size but are not meant for bookshelves. Stands are ridiculously over priced and often wobbly. These are at a much better price, are substantial and heavy and allow for best sound in seated room (24"). Well made, you can even trust KEF LS50W without needing sand or weights added. Very nice looking for living room and hide speaker wire nicely
customer_reviews.author: Disinterested Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: Nice looking, sturdy stands
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to assemble. Nice build quality. The glass base looks good. This is probably as tasteful as you are going to get for a speaker stand.
customer_reviews.author: Seafood Licorice

customer_reviews.title: Great value but......
customer_reviews.text: Great stands but the carpet spikes need to be longer
customer_reviews.author: jeffrey S. Marshall

customer_reviews.title: Great price and solid quality!
customer_reviews.text: I had low expectations, but found these are surprisingly good for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Deanna

customer_reviews.title: na
customer_reviews.text: Nice product for the money. The tops could be a little bigger.
customer_reviews.author: rick l.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value
customer_reviews.text: Solid stands with adjustable spikes to account for uneven surfaces and rubber tips for bare wood floors. Looks good too.
customer_reviews.author: Tweaker

customer_reviews.title: Great stands!
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful quality speaker stands, super easy to put together, Styrofoam packaging gets everywhere however.
customer_reviews.author: M L

customer_reviews.title: Great Stands!  Worth every penny!
customer_reviews.text: Wow!!! Beautiful sturdy stands. Well worth their price. Simple to install.

customer_reviews.title: easy to put together and it looks excellent
customer_reviews.text: Very high quality, easy to put together and it looks excellent.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very nice speaker stands. I have the B&W C5SS sitting on them .Perfect fit!
customer_reviews.author: Visa

customer_reviews.title: sturdy and perfect for my 6 1/2 inch speakers
customer_reviews.text: Solid, sturdy and perfect for my 6 1/2 inch speakers.
customer_reviews.author: Ron Bolin

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up and looks great. Worth the money!
customer_reviews.author: S. Lee

customer_reviews.title: GREAT LOOKING STANDS
customer_reviews.text: THESE STANDS ARE GREAT LOOKING AND SERVE THEIR PURPOSE WELL.MOST DON'T HAVE THE SHINY BLACK FINISH.THEY WERE PRETTY EASY TO PUT TOGETHER.
customer_reviews.author: david A.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Few things here and there but berry good for the price
customer_reviews.author: Nelson Garcia

customer_reviews.title: Thank you for the excellent photos and description
customer_reviews.text: Thank you for the excellent photos and description. These speaker stand arrived as described and perfect for my application. Bravo.
customer_reviews.author: GLP

customer_reviews.title: THESE ARE TO SHORT ONLY 24 INCH. NEVER NOTICED ...
customer_reviews.text: THESE ARE TO SHORT ONLY 24 INCH . NEVER NOTICED THAT WHEN I ORDERED M SPENT AN EXTRA 20 BUCKS ON HALF SHEET OF PLYWOOD NAILS AND PAINT TOLTAL ADDIONAL COST OF ABOUT $40 AND 2 TO 3 HRS LABOR. NEEDS TO BE ABOUT 30 TO 32 INCHES TALL.I BUILT A BOX TO GO ON TOP.
customer_reviews.author: cat daddy

product_meta.title: TransDeco Speaker Stands, 24", Black -
feature_bullets: Constructed with tempered glass with beveled edges and heavy gauge steel with high gloss black finish ;
Adjustable spike feet for uneven floor and to improve speaker performance and reduce sound distortion;
Included soft pad for added security to the speaker;
Built in wire management system; Included spike feet cover for hardwood floor protection;
Dimensions: 24″ H x 9.5″ W x 11.8″ D

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.7 out of 5 stars133 ratings4.7 out of 5 stars
